body: There won't be many people around here to help get this to build on Amiga.

> There won't be many people around here to help get this to build on Amiga.

Yeah I thought it might be a little light on Amiga users in here - 

The thing compiles - just doesn't work as intended - every URL you give it, brings back this error when running on the Amiga

![amicurl](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dc0bf58e-d92c-4f06-9723-c4ae66f35b74)

I've had a look through the code, and don't know where to start - I assume the URL string is not being picked up correctly - all the -(options) work correctly when used.
You should probably set a break-point in `lib/urlapi.c:parseurl()` and single-step forward to see at what point it bails out.

issue.title: Makefile.mk: drop in favour of autotools and cmake (MS-DOS, AmigaOS3)

labels.name: feature-window
labels.description: A merge of this requires an open feature window

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
`Makefile.mk` supported MS-DOS and Amiga, but `./configure` also
supported them in a better tested and more flexible way.

This patch also adds CMake support for MS-DOS/DJGPP and Amiga OS 3.

`Makefile.mk` was not maintained. Delete it in favour of first-tier
build methods.

Also include some non-MS-DOS/AmigaOS-specific tidy-up, see details at
the end of this message.

Details:

- fix/silence all MS-DOS/DJGPP build warnings and issues.
- add MS-DOS support to cmake.
  - default to `ENABLE_THREADED_RESOLVER=OFF` for MS-DOS.
  - add support for `WATT_ROOT`.
  - use static libcurl with MS-DOS.
  - fixup default CMake suffixes/prefixes for DJGPP.
  - disable hidden symbols for MS-DOS. Not supported on MS-DOS.
  - opt-in MS-DOS into `USE_UNIX_SOCKETS`.
- improve MS-DOS support in autotools.
  - default to `--disable-threaded-resolver` for MS-DOS.
- make sure to use `close_s()` (from Watt-32) with autotools and cmake.
  `Makefile.mk` used it before this patch.
- GHA: add DJGPP cmake (~30s) and autotools (~60s) build jobs.
  Also build tests and examples with cmake.
- improve AmigaOS support in autotools:
  - configure: detect `CloseSocket()` when it's a macro.
  - configure: fix `IoctlSocket` detection on AmigaOS.
  - curl-amissl.m4: pass AmiSSL libs to tests/servers.
- add AmigaOS3 support to cmake:
  - cmake: fix `HAVE_IOCTLSOCKET_CAMEL` and
    `HAVE_IOCTLSOCKET_CAMEL_FIONBIO` detections.
  - set necessary system libs.
  - add AmiSSL support.
  - inet_ntop, inet_pton: fix using it for AmigaOS. cmake detects them,
    and they did not compile with AmigaOS.
  - cmake: better sync `gethostname` detection with autotools.
    Fixes detection for AmigaOS, where `gethostname` is a macro.
  - cmake: fix `sys/utime.h` detection on AmigaOS.
  - cmake: force-disable `getaddrinfo` for AmigaOS.
  - cmake: tweak threading and static/shared default for AmigaOS.
  - cmake: rely on manual variable `AMIGA` to enable the platform.
- GHA: add AmigaOS cmake and autotools (~45s) jobs.
  Also build tests and examples with cmake.
- INSTALL: update MS-DOS and AmigaOS build instructions.
- amigaos: fix `-Wpointer-sign` and
  `zero or negative size array '_args'` in `Printf()`.
- amigaos: fix `-Wpointer-sign`
- amigaos: fix `-Wredundant-decls` `errno` and `h_errno`.
- amigaos: brute-force silence `lseek()` size warnings.
- amigaos: server/resolve: silence `-Wdiscarded-qualifiers`.
- amigaos: server/resolve: fix `-Wpointer-sign`.
- amigaos: fix `CURL_SA_FAMILY_T` type.
- nonblock: prefer `HAVE_IOCTLSOCKET_CAMEL_FIONBIO` for AmigaOS.
  `ioctl` is also detected, but fails when used. Make the above override
  it for a successful build.
  Authored-by: Darren Banfi
  Fixes #15537
  Closes #15603
- tftpd: prefer `HAVE_IOCTLSOCKET_CAMEL_FIONBIO` for AmigaOS.
- tftpd: tidy-up conditional code.
- curl: set stack size to 16384 for AmigaOS3/4
  Overriding the default 4096.
  Suggested-by: Darren Banfi
  Ref: https://github.com/curl/curl/pull/15543#issuecomment-2498783123
  Ref: https://wiki.amigaos.net/wiki/Controlling_Application_Stack
- functypes.h: fix `SEND_QUAL_ARG2` for AmigaOS.
- tftp: add missing cast in sendto() call for AmigaOS.
- getinfo: fix warning with AmigaOS.
- tool_operate: silence warning with AmigaOS
- amigaos: fix building libtests due to missing `RLIMIT_NOFILE`.
- curl_gethostname: silence warning for AmigaOS.
- ftp: silence `-Wtype-limits` for AmigaOS.
- libtest: fix timeval initialization for AmigaOS.
- examples: fix `timeval` initialization for AmigaOS.
- examples: silence warning for AmigaOS.
- configure: fix IPv6 detection for cross-builds.
- netrc: fix to build with AmigaOS cleanly.
- buildinfo: detect and add `DOS` tag for MS-DOS builds.
- buildinfo: add `AMIGA` to buildinfo.txt in auttools.
- build: move `USE_WATT32` macro definition to cmake/configure.

Non-MS-DOS/AmigeOS-specific tidy-ups:

- configure: sync `sa_family_t` detection with cmake.
- configure: sync `ADDRESS_FAMILY` detection signals with cmake.
- doh: use `CURL_SA_FAMILY_T`.
- lib: drop mingw-specific `CURL_SA_FAMILY_T` workaround.
- cmake: extend instead of override check-specific
  configurations/requirements.
  This allows to honor global requirements added earlier.
  Necessary for AmigaOS for example.
- cmake: omit warning on disabled IPv6 for MS-DOS and AmigaOS.
  No IPv6 support on these platforms. Also sync with autotools.
- lib1960: use libcurl `inet_pton()` wrapper.
- cmake: detect LibreSSL (to match autotools).
- cmake: say the specific OpenSSL flavour detected.
- hostip: add missing `HAVE_SOCKADDR_IN6_SIN6_SCOPE_ID` guard.
- lib: simplify classic mac feature guards.

Follow-up to a8861b6ccdd7ca35b6115588a578e36d765c9e38 #9764

---

- [x] split into multiple PRs or commits? [MERGE AS-IS]

w/o whitespace: https://github.com/curl/curl/pull/15543/files?w=1

body:
> You should probably set a break-point in `lib/urlapi.c:parseurl()` and single-step forward to see at what point it bails out.

Thanks for the tip on that, I don't have an IDE on the amiga - as it's a cross compile I can't step in to the built exe on that platform.

I did however put some printf's in to see if I could work our where it bombs out, but I think it's outside of this function as covering all breaks on URL_MALFORMed it still pops up as the error  - the URL is parsed fine and it detects the protocol correctly. -then gives that error of bad/illegal url

I'm wondering if it could be a missing define at compile time causing this issue: 
as I'm using configure to make this (the old way was the makefile route which doesn't work) I wonder if the defines that are in /libs/config-amigaos.h are not being picked up by Configure - I know this as the HAVE_IOCTLSOCKET_CAMEL_FIONBIO defined in that file doesn't get picked up at compile time even through it's set in config-amigaos.h.

There is a lot of defines in that file which I'll have to translate to the configure.ac file as AC_DEFINE, AC_SUBST to test.

Hopefully I can make something work.

So i've tested with all the defines in config-amigaos.h by putting them in the configure statement manually

`./buildconf && PKG_CONFIG=true ./configure --host=m68k-amigaos --build=$(uname -m)-pc-linux-gnu CC=m68k-amigaos-gcc AR=m68k-amigaos-ar --disable-shared --disable-ipv6 --prefix=/opt/amiga13 --disable-netrc --without-libpsl --with-amissl --disable-threaded-resolver CFLAGS="-fomit-frame-pointer -m68040 -O2 -msoft-float -Wno-system-headers -mcrt=clib2" CPPFLAGS="-D__AMIGA__ -DHAVE_ARPA_INET_H=1 -DHAVE_CLOSESOCKET_CAMEL=1 -DHAVE_IOCTLSOCKET_CAMEL=1 -DHAVE_IOCTLSOCKET_CAMEL_FIONBIO=1 -DHAVE_LONGLONG=1 -DHAVE_NETDB_H=1 -DHAVE_NETINET_IN_H=1 -DHAVE_NET_IF_H=1 -DHAVE_PWD_H=1 -DHAVE_SELECT=1 -DHAVE_SIGNAL=1 -DHAVE_SOCKET=1 -DHAVE_STRCASECMP=1 -DHAVE_STRDUP=1 -DHAVE_STRICMP=1 -DHAVE_STRINGS_H=1 -DHAVE_STRUCT_TIMEVAL=1 -DHAVE_SYS_PARAM_H=1 -DHAVE_SYS_SOCKET_H=1 -DHAVE_SYS_SOCKIO_H=1 -DHAVE_SYS_STAT_H=1 -DHAVE_SYS_TIME_H=1 -DHAVE_SYS_TYPES_H=1 -DHAVE_UNISTD_H=1 -DHAVE_UTIME=1 -DHAVE_UTIME_H=1 -DHAVE_WRITABLE_ARGV=1 -DHAVE_SYS_IOCTL_H=1 -DNEED_MALLOC_H=1 -DSIZEOF_INT=1 -DSIZEOF_SIZE_T=1 -DSIZEOF_CURL_OFF_T=8 -DUSE_MANUAL=1 -DCURL_DISABLE_LDAP=1 -DCURL_OS=AmigaOS -DSTDC_HEADERS=1 -DF_OK=0 -DHAVE_RECV=1 -DHAVE_SEND=1" LIBS="-lnet -lm -lc -lz -lunix -latomic"`

but that doesn't fix the bug - every url passed to curl gives the error curl: (3) URL using bad/illegal format or missing URL

This error is triggered on CURLUE_MALFORMED_INPUT

Putting a  fprintf(stderr, "Location\n"); in before each break statement I can see it's failing at the code

Inside Function - curl_url_set

`if (!nalloc)
 /* a blank URL is not a valid URL */
 return CURLUE_MALFORMED_INPUT;`

Trying to debug backwards now to work out how it got to !nalloc

Hard to debug with fprintf statements, but some little progress :

if I run curl google.com
curl_url_set receives the url as google.com
it passes this to parse and replace function correctly.
This in turn passes it over to  parseurl
This guesses the scheme correctly and then I get to the end with a 0 result - the url seems to vanish here somewhere.
curl_url_set runs again but this time the url is blank
and then we get the error curl: (3) URL using bad/illegal format or missing URL)

Here is the parseurl code that calls curl_url_set to guess the scheme in curl 8.11.0:

https://github.com/curl/curl/blob/b1ef0e1a01c0bb6ee5367bd9c186a603bde3615a/lib/url.c#L1762-L1783

`data->state.url` after that block should point to `http://google.com/` (as long as [--proto-default](https://curl.se/docs/manpage.html#--proto-default) was not used on the command line or in the curlrc)

> curl_url_set runs again but this time the url is blank

Does that happen before, during or after the transfer? The connection is created by ~~parseandfill~~ create_conn (which calls parseandfill) then it should make the connection. I'm pretty sure there shouldn't be another set call unless there's a successful connection with a Location header in the reply. If the server replies with a Location header (like google redirects to www.google.com) then curl will parse that url by calling curl_url_set. However where it is called in the code I think depends on whether or not redirects are enabled.

Thanks for the guidance on this Jay

so after many more fprintfs I can confirm it seems to run in this order

curl google.com

curl_url_set first run

CURLcode create_conn runs 
!use_set_uh runs
I can only fprintf the state.url in decimal so it does contain something (In decimal 142924196)~
and it leaves via
 result = parseurlandfillconn(data, conn);
  if(result){
    goto out;
  }

curl_url set 2nd run

Error URL Using bad/illagal fomat of missing URL

the fprintf don't seem to go in that order - not sure if one part calls before the other and fprintf is just catching up

I don't know if this helps in anyway - defiantly something doesn't go through 

screenshot of the various fprintf parts below 

![IMG_2806](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6ee2334a-b011-44dd-9585-c5f40ee61fc4)

Hi Jay
The more fprintf I put in the more it crashes,
if i try and use %s on the data->state.url it crashes the amiga to a software failure - no idea why.

now doing curl -v google.com - doesn't print any verbose out to the console? just my fprintfs come out.

I've recompiled 8.11.0 to a new folder - and curl -v google.com does the same, no verbose.
Just straight to the curl: (3) URL using bad/illegal format of missing URL

Could it be curl is not making a connection and not reporting it somehow?

This bug started off with the nonblock.c code not compiling as it picked up the unix method until I moved the part of the code ahead

```
#elif defined(HAVE_IOCTLSOCKET_CAMEL_FIONBIO)

  /* Amiga */
  long flags = nonblock ? 1L : 0L;
  return IoctlSocket(sockfd, FIONBIO, (char *)&flags);
```

Could that have something to do with it?

or do I need to check the code for the bsdsocket.library - has it somehow failed to do anything with this.

Apologies if I get some of this wrong, I'm not a C Programmer - so reading C is me looking in the C Manual and then doing

I think it is unlikely that changing to IoCtlSocket would cause crashes in this area and that there is memory corruption occurring somewhere else. I don't know how to better debug this in Amiga except with printfs to find a good point before the corruption occurs. Apparently stack traces are possible, see https://wiki.amigaos.net/wiki/Using_Crash-Logs_for_Debugging

> I think it is unlikely that changing to IoCtlSocket would cause crashes in this area and that there is memory corruption occurring somewhere else. I don't know how to better debug this in Amiga except with printfs to find a good point before the corruption occurs. Apparently stack traces are possible, see https://wiki.amigaos.net/wiki/Using_Crash-Logs_for_Debugging

Thanks for the assistance Jay this is much appreciated!

So tonight's testing, I can confirm there is no network tcp stack working in the curl compiled exe.
If I turn off the amiga TCP stack (Roadshow) the same error occurs. curl (3): URL using bad/illegal format or missing URL

I've been trying to work our how the curl code works with Amiga TCP stacks
Looking at libs/amigaos.c this has code to open the bsdsocket.library for AmigaOS3 and fail if it doesn't work.
it also is referencing amitcp/socketbasetags.h if we are using AmiSSL
The Amiga GCC has this included in the amitcp folder so should be OK

My Amiga uses Roadshow as it's TCP stack (it's newer - and my other Amiga use this) I assume it shouldn't matter on the Amiga side, as bsdsocket.library is included with Roadshow as well.

I've tried changing this to roadshows newer TCP SDK by changing the include to <bsdsocket/socketbasetags.h> as well but so far all builds have no TCP stack support.

More testing this weekend

So tonight I'm concentrating on the Amigaos.c and Amigaos.H

Amigaos.h seems to have a couple of functions in it that setup curl for Amiga and how to attach the socket library

Getting them to add there functions in at build time gives an error - 

  CCLD     curl
/opt/amiga13/lib/gcc/m68k-amigaos/13.2.0/../../../../m68k-amigaos/bin/ld: /opt/amiga13/lib/libamisslauto.a(autoinit_assl.o):autoinit_assl.o:(.data+0x4): multiple definition of `SocketBase'; ../lib/.libs/libcurl.a(libcurl_la-amigaos.o):libcurl_la-amigaos.o:(.bss+0x0): first defined here

it seems that the socketbase in amigaos.c is also conflicting with amissl's socketbase

Will look at this more tomorrow - I can't work out what options we should be running to make sure we use the correct method for socket in AmigaOS3

We have life in Curl on AmigaOS3! 

I had to add to the configure.ac to set the Amiga nonblocking method and change nonblock.c to make sure the Amiga nonblocking method works. 

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2f98d4d7-2abe-4d91-9f85-15031295c223)

Downside it's not stable, this maybe a compiler option problem so working on that next. It curls or crashes 

I'll put the changes up on my folk this weekend once I'm happy with it.

It's very compiler sensitive. Setting it down to m68000 with no optimisations makes it run correctly. 

So i have a build that's stable

Pushing my changes over now since it's confirmed working. 

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/316c4181-775b-43de-bb43-e07975ceb993)
